instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924-09 no display water damage
threads.message: Hi. I have board after water damage where i replaced damaged components but i dont have any picture on screen nothing even i put light behind or on central point of screen. Sound coming out from speakers.

threads.title: 820-4924-09 no display water damage
threads.message:
Where was the spill?
Post some voltages of LCD connector...

threads.title: 820-4924-09 no display water damage
threads.message: Yeah voltage present at the inductor powering the screen? Tried known good 2015 LCD?

threads.title: 820-4924-09 no display water damage
threads.message:
j8300 connector:
pin: 28,29,30 - 5.15v
pin: 1 - 0.003v

liquid was on lcd connector with i replaced two of then just in case

threads.title: 820-4924-09 no display water damage
threads.message: So you at least should have image with a known good screen. Resistance to ground on backlight output (pin 1) with and without a screen attached?

threads.title: 820-4924-09 no display water damage
threads.message:
Post U8330/40 voltages.
Also read this thread...
[URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/41624-820-4924-no-video-or-backlight"]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards...o-or-backlight[/URL]

threads.title: 820-4924-09 no display water damage
threads.message:
U8330:
pin1: 3.3v
pin2: 0.01v
pin3: 3.3v
pin5: 0.01v
pin6: 3.3v
pin7: 3.3v
pin8: 3.3v

also FL8300-3 coils (good)

D7710  pin1: 0.00v  pin2: 0.00v

threads.title: 820-4924-09 no display water damage
threads.message: Did you check all the things mentioned in the above link?
